titleStmt.title: William Weddle to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6267

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos. E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Wm. Weddle states that at the Mar term of the Pulaski circuit court for 186 a judgment was rendered against him in favor of the Comth of Kentucky for the sum of $30.00 and at the term of said court another judgment was rendered as aforesaid for the amt of $.

He further states that said judgts was rendered against him for assout and breach of the peace. He states that previous to the indictments aforesaid he had been arrested and tried for the same offense before a Justice of the Peace for said county and the same had been tried and terminated and that he was not liable to indictment.
He further ^states^ that he could not be at the trial and make the defense:
Wherefore he asks that the fine be remitted

State of Kentucky
Pulaski County } SS.

I Solomon Weddle a Justice of the Peace for said county do hereby certify that from the records of my office and from my own personal knowledge that the facts stated by the petitioner are true. There had been a judgment before a Justice of the Peace
for the offense before the indictment referred to
Given under my hand this 18 day of March 1865
We the undersigned respectfully ask that so much of said fine as can be, be remitted, believing the same to ^be^ right there having been a former judgment in the case

Daniel Tartar
W. Norfleet
B B Dunbar
C. J. Sievers
S. Pennington
H. Tarter
William wood
A D Taylor
William Burkhart
David Cowen
William Burge
J. M. Weddle.
F Molden
Laban Tarter
W G Cundiffe
T Tarrington

Pulaski Cir Ct
vs
Wm Weddle
$30 --
